column5: Archaeopteryx
A bird that lived in ancient times.
Though it had primitive wings, discoveries of it
are rare and not much is known about how it lived.
[Dinosaur Egg]
A bundle of ancient dinosaur egg fossils.
For some reason they were buried in sand.
You can observe tiny dinosaur skeletons inside.
[Ammonite] Ammonoidea
Mollusc that lived in ancient times.
A common ancient organism whose fossils
can be found throughout the world. Even now,
there are conflicting opinions on its classification.
[Trilobite] Trilobita
Common ancient arthropod.
It is thought to have crawled around ancient
oceans, eating mud and such.
[Cobra] Elapidae
Large venomous snake.
It threatens by standing up the front part of its body,
using a pleated organ to fire warning sounds.
[Sea Turtle] Chelonioidea
Sea reptile with oar-shaped limbs.
Known to be extremely long-lived,
specimens may live for 100 years or more.
[Owl] Strigidae
Nocturnal bird with good night vision.
Preferring tree cavities, at night they cry with
their distinctive 'hoo, hoo' call.
[Penguin] Spheniscidae
Sea bird living in cold regions.
They stand erect and walk unsteadily on land.
Because they raise their chicks in groups,
they have been dubbed the 'human bird.'
[Frog] Anura
Amphibian that lives near water.
Though when they are small, they have a fishlike appearance,
when they are grown they climb to land, with a noisy
'croak, croak' call.
[Eagle] Haliaeetus leucocephalus
Large bird known for its courage.
It spreads its great wings out when it flies, and
is sometimes known to carry off even small calves.
It is considered the 'king of the skies.'
[Ancient Wolf] Canis
A carnivorous species that acts in groups.
It is thought that 'dogs' are a species
originally born of tamed wolves.
[Ancient Bear] Ursus
Ancient white animal with a large build.
Living in the middle of cold regions,
it preys on seals and dolphins.
[Dodo] Raphidae
Large bird called the Dodo.
Because it can't fly, it was over-hunted by
humans, and sadly, is now considered extinct.
[Giant Deer] Megaloceros giganteus
Ancient large animal with a splendid pair of horns.
Males swung their horns, larger than their bodies,
to fight off their enemies.
[Sabretooth] Smilodon
Big cat that lived in ancient times.
Plunging its naked tusks deeply, it is thought to
have brought down its prey with a single blow.
[Frilled Lizard] Chlamydosaurus
Reptile with characteristic frills around its neck.
Strongly territorial, it expands its frills to
threaten its opponents.

Quit
Tyrannosaurus
Reptile species that lived in ancient times.
Appropriately nicknamed 'tyrant dragon,' it has a large
body and fangs, and is thought to have preyed upon all
manner of other animals.
Tyrannosaur Skeleton
It seems to be the skeleton of a tyrannosauroid.
Because part of it is missing, further details are unknown.
Pteranodon
Reptile species that lived in ancient times.
It is thought to have hunted by swooping down
from the high skies with its large wings.
Pterosaur Skeleton
It seems to be the skeleton of a pterosaur.
Because part of it is missing, further details are unknown.
Triceratops
Reptile species that lived in ancient times.
Having three large horns and a collar, it seems
to have fought like the water buffalo, by charging.
Ceratops Skeleton
It seems to be the skeleton of a ceratopsian.
Because part of it is missing, further details are unknown.
Plesiosaurus
Reptile species that lived in ancient times.
Calmly swimming in the sea, it is thought to have
used its long neck to prey on fish and squid.
Plesiosaur Skeleton
It seems to be the skeleton of a plesiosaur.
Because part of it is missing, further details are unknown.
（ＮＯ　ＤＡＴＡ）
It looks like there's nothing on display.

for fossils and taxidermies...
There's even real dioramas...

ANI_JOY

interesting pass me by...
